atomica.ui.util.board
Class GameBoardPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  atomica.ui.util.components.AtomicaPanel
                      atomica.ui.util.board.BoardPanel
                          atomica.ui.util.board.GameBoardPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class GameBoardPanel
extends BoardPanel

Displays the game board when playing a game. It allows user interaction by moving atoms to an empty field and will also display the shortest path.

Author:
Georg Ludewig
See Also:
Serialized Form

paintFieldHighLight

protected void paintFieldHighLight(Field field,
                                   java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
Paints field highlights if a token on the board is selected to be moved. A highlight will be painted on the field of the selected token as well as on the field of the current mouse position.

Overrides:
paintFieldHighLight in class BoardPanel
Parameters:
field - the field where to paint a highlight
g2 - the Graphic2D object to paint to
See Also:
BoardPanel.paintFieldHighLight(atomica.objects.Field, java.awt.Graphics2D)

paintShortestPath

void paintShortestPath(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
Paints the shortest path between the selected atom and the destination field.

Parameters:
g2 - the Graphic2D object

handleMouseMoved

protected void handleMouseMoved(int x,
                                int y)
Sets the current cursorPostionField so that this field is highlighted after a repaint. It also indicates the destination field when painting the shortest path. If the game is over this method wont set that field so it wont be highlighted.

Overrides:
handleMouseMoved in class BoardPanel
Parameters:
x - the horizontal position of the mouse cursor
y - the vertical position of the mouse cursor
See Also:
BoardPanel.handleMouseMoved(int, int)

handleMouseReleased

protected void handleMouseReleased(int x,
                                   int y)
Releasing the mouse indicates that either a new atom was selected to being moved or an already selected atom shall be placed on a destination field. According to that this method sets the new token or calls the model (Game) about moving the token.

Overrides:
handleMouseReleased in class BoardPanel
Parameters:
x - the horizontal position of the mouse cursor
y - the vertical position of the mouse cursor
See Also:
BoardPanel.handleMouseReleased(int, int)
